comm: on a length, no swing, defended towards cover-point. Sets off for a non-existent single. Sent back in time

Mustafizur to Sharma in last three balls: 0 runs, 2 wickets. Loose shot. Really really loose shot. Will Kohli come out to face the music now? Sharma first. Drives loosely at a length ball away from the body. Doesn't come as quickly as he expects it to, and ends up slicing it to point. He is prone to doing this early on, and that is why despite the numbers he is not an ideal choice for an opener
on a length, just outside off, Kohli defends. He doesn't like leaving the ball alone. He likes bat on ball
no mid-off in place, the ball is full, a half-volley, and Kohli pushes it through the mid-off gap for three runs
length ball, angling in, no movement off the straight. Defended to leg
on a length, just outside off, angling in, defended off the front foot
oh heavy ball. Short of a length, into the ribs, and it explodes, and even the keeper struggles with the extra bounce. Kohli watches it go under his armpit. Harshly it has been called a wide
short of a length, on the pads, defended to leg
an excitable appeal. He has beaten Dhawan with the extra bounce, but the ball has pitched outside leg and has hit the thigh pad. Beaten for pace and bounce, though
on a length, angling towards the top of leg stump, defended to cover
short ball, chest high, pulled away, into the ground. The outfield is super quick. Tamim from long leg doesn't have too far to go to his right but the ball beats his dive
just short of a length, within the stumps, Dhawan defends from the crease
short and wide, Dhawan looks to cut, is beaten. The crowd goes up as the ball passes the bat, but umpire Tucker calls it a wide. A rather harsh call
off the shoulder of the bat as he looks to punch this but is done in by extra bounce. There is no gully, though
a proper wide for a change. Well down leg
short of a length, just outside off, and he has punched this wide of mid-off. Lovely shot
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
the crowd cheers again as Mustafizur fields in his follow-through and lets rip a throw at the striker's end. Dhawan is safe
lovely bowling. On a length, just outside off, Dhawan plays, and he plays the angle. The ball holds its line, and beats the outside edge by a whisker
short of a length, and this one jags back in after pitching, beating Dhawan's attempt to whip it. Hits him high on the thigh pad. No appeal for a change
there is the offcutter. Dhawan hasn't picked it. In fact he has stepped out, and the ball dips on him, and cuts back in to hit the pad
gets a big stride in to defend a length ball outside off
short of a length, rising towards the chest, angling in, defended off the back foot
just short of a length, outside off, Kohli stays back to defend
he is trying to keep it wide, but that length needs to be spot on. This time he goes a touch too short, and Kohli cuts him powerfully. Doesn't bother keeping it down. One bounce four over point
better length, can't cut this, and he has to leave it alone. Just inside the tram line
bouncer, good sharp bouncer, Das has to fly to get a hand to it and Sarkar from slip cleans up behind him. However, he has overstepped. Just by an inch, but still a no-ball
and Kohli has defended a free hit. Short of a length, wide, and as he doesn't know this is a free hit, he just defends it to point
on a length, just outside off, doesn't quite come on, and Dhawan's drive is off its time
short of a length, angling in, whipped away past midwicket. Indecision while taking the third. Sent back. Kohli has come up half way before he looks up at Dhawan who has held his hand up
on a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short ball, slower short ball, 123ks, but this has sat up chest high for Dhawan to pull it through midwicket
offcutter again but Dhawan is now picking them, and drives it past point for a single

Kohli has not picked the offcutter. He commits to a forward movement early, Mustafizur gives it a rip, and the ball sticks into the pitch before cutting away. Strangely, Kohli follows it and is beaten
on a length, within the stumps, angling towards off, defended back to him
short of a length, worked to leg
a length ball on the pads and Dhawan opens up the stance a little to whip this through midwicket for four
slower ball, fuller too, on the pads, towards off it goes. Defended
down the wicket, but Mortaza bowls an even slower offcutter to beat his poke
regulation pace, short of a length, defended to cover
offcutter, on a length, middle and leg, defended outside off by Kohli
that is a wide, starts too far outside off and goes on with the angle
that's a half-volley, a long half-volley that he has pushed straight to mid-off. Over-cautious?
a more purposeful drive to a half-volley, but even this goes straight to mid-off. Not looking confident enough to open the face and go through cover
there is the edge but it falls short of the lone slip. This is not a cutter. Just seam up, on off and angling away. Kohli plays with an open face. Defending. The edge doesn't carry
now Kohli wealks down the pitch, pushes a length ball wide of mid-off, and takes a single
mid-on is very wide, and Dhawan pushes a length ball through that vacant region
short of a length, on off, Dhawan stays back to push this to cover
length ball on off, punched to deep point for one
half-volley just outside off, pushes this to mid-off
length ball, outside off, holds its line, defended off the back foot
takes the calculated risk. Dances down the wicket, is not quite to the pitch of a length ball but manages to chip it over wide mid-on for a four
wide length ball, he steps forward and defends
short of a length, just outside off, punched away nicely, but can't beat backward point
fuller, slower ball, Dhawan recovers well to push it straight of mid-on for one
loose loose shot. Kohli is lucky to still be there. On a length, angling away, he plays without feet, and with an angled bat. Seriously lucky to not edge it

that's a good comeback. Lovely response from Kohli. He is not letting Mustafizur dictate terms. Kohli has picked the cutter this time, and has charged at him to loft him over mid-on for six. He has told the bowler he is picking the slower ball, and not only picking it, he intends to hit it big
regulation pace, on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
and again he has picked the slower ball, charged at him, reached the pitch of the ball, and taken it from just outside off to flick it between mid-on and midwicket for four all along the ground
on a length, middle and leg, defended towards cover
on a length, Dhawan waits for it, opens the face and jabs at it to send it past cover for two
crisp punch shot on off, but straight to short cover

one-handed cut. A touch short, and wide with the angle so Dhawan lashes at it. It is a slower ball so he has to wait. The bottom hand comes off as he makes contact, but places it in front of point for four
lovely shot. Down the wicket, another slower ball, he has picked it, and played just a push-drive on the up. And he has managed to place this between short cover and extra cover
short of a length, on off, pushes this with soft hands towards points, and comes through for one
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
flighted outside off, pushed to long-off
into the pads, and helped away for a single
into the pads again, quite flat, defended back to him
down the wicket, Hossain pulls the length back, he defends
leaves the crease again, Hossian slows it down and tosses it up wide, defended to cover
into the pads this time, and is whipped to deep midwicket
just short of a length, punched to short cover
loose. Dhawan gives him the charge, but Rubel is not bowling cutters here. Just a full and fast delivery to beat his outside edge
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to short cover
rip-roaring bouncer. Dhawan nonchalantly sways out of its line. That is a wide actually but it has not been called a wide. Gets away with it
lovely drive. Not a half-volley by any means. Just pushes his weight into the drive, and sends it crashing past cover for four. All long the ground
tucked away off the pads for one
on a length, on off, pushed with soft hands between point and cover for one
this offbreak doesn't turn, Kohli has to defend it back as he reads it off the pitch

lack of turn does Kohli in again. Fatally this time. There is a send-off here. Kohli is not happy. He stands there and looks at the Bangladesh fielders. If not a send-off, at least there is something said to him. First the delivery then. This is an offbresk, short of a length, pitches off, looks easy meat for at least a single to leg. Kohli plays for the turn, the ball not only doesn't turn, it also skids through to stay low. Plumb lbw
defends an offbreak off the front foot
a lunge forward to defend in front of leg
another lunge forward, Hossain bowls straight, and Dhoni defends
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point
short of a length, just outside off, Dhoni's quick hands into the punch shot, but can't beat point
short of a length, goes for the punch away from his body, but he hits it in the air, and it lands just short of point
slightly shorter than the length on the last two balls, and Dhoni goes back to ruthlessly punch this between point and cover for four
stays back to punch another short-of-length delivery, but straight to short cover
another punch shot, places it wide of deep cover, comes back for two
down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, drives it to long-off for one
down the wicket to push this to leg for one
short of a length, on off, punched to deep cover for one
short of a length, stays low a little, punched back to him
forced through point. There is no pace on the ball but the strong arms of Dhoni have punched it through point. In the air but into the gap
defended to leg
short of a length, into the body, punched to deep midwicket for one
flighted outside off, Dhoni gets too close to the pitch of the ball and yorks himself up
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
slightly short of a length, he rocks back to cut this to deep cover
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
short, too short, pulled to long-on for one
this offbreak stays low, and he defends this to square leg
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, defends
flatter delivery, defended to leg
careless backing up. Dhoni turns this to square leg for one, but they concede the overthrow with Mortaza not getting around properly
works this past square leg for one. For a moment Dhawan says no, but the ball is well wide of square leg. Easy single after that momentary indecision
flat delivery, into his body, punched to midwicket
flighted on middle and leg, defended to Shakib's right
stays back to push a tossed-up delivery to cover
flighted, slower through the air, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, worked with the turn, past square leg, brings up his fifty
slightly short, but very slow, which means Dhoni has to curb the cut that he is shaping up for
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
down the wicket, Nasir shortens the length, and he has to defend it to leg
short of a length, Dhoni misses out as he punches this straight to short midwicket
worked into the leg side for one
another dot as he slows it down
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
short of a length, middle and off, punched to the right of Nasir but not wide enough
Dhawan is down the wicket, and Shakib follows him and the ball turns and bounces to hit him on the pad. Lucky it has not lobbed off to the keeper
leaves the crease again and gets a single to long-on
Dhoni too down the wicket, pushes this full ball to long-on
swept from middle and leg, for a single to deep backward square leg
nicely bowled. Slow through the air, dipping on him, turning away, defended in front of his body
a touch too straight, and easily dropped into the leg side for a single
leaves the crease, Hossain pulls the length back, he defends to leg
dropped by Das. Dhoni looks for a paddle sweep, the ball is slipping down leg, takes his glove on the way, and Das is looking away. The keeper is hit on the pad
Dhoni of old. Never mind if it doesn't look pretty. Dhoni is down the wicket, and slugs a full ball over square leg
punched down to long-on for one

lovely catch. Redeems himself after missing that really tough one earlier in the over. Dhawan is down the wicket again, the ball is slow, beats him in the flight, turns away to take the edge. Das catches it, and doesn't even stump him just in case. Some confidence in umpires' getting it right then? Also with Dhawan you don't need to worry about umpires. He walks, as he does here
and even he leaves the crease first ball and Nasir shortens the length to beat him in the flight. Defended to leg
on a length, seaming back in, Dhoni defends off the back foot
short of a length, just outside off, he goes deep into the crease to defend this to leg for a single
short of a length, heavy ball, hits the sticker on the bat as he goes to defend

Rayudu comes. Rayudu goes. Dug in short, this is pulling length, but Rayudu goes to cut it. Which means it is difficult to keep it down. He is off his feet to try to keep it down, but he has made a wrong choice of the shot. He cuts and tries his best to send it down, but it travels low to point where Nasir Hossain takes the catch. An all-Hossain dismissal
bouncer first up. Not a surprise at all. Raina sways out of its line
short of a length, just outside off, Raina is deep in the crease, defends this to cover
offbreak stays low, he somehow manages to punch this to long-on for one
Raina edges this past slip. His feet are stuck as he pushes at an offbreak. Soft edge that wouldn't have carried even if it had gone to slip
short of a length, holds its line, punched back to the bowler
short again, stays a touch low, punched to cover
arm ball, this is fuller, and goes on with the angle. Defended off the front foot
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
Raina all at sea. Bouncer. Sharp bouncer. Raina really late into the pull. The top shot flies over the keeper's head
short of a length, angling away, Raina pushes at it with no conviction,. Beaten by the angle and the bounce
tucked away off the hip for one
goes back and across to defend a shortish delivery
slightly slower, Dhoni waits for it, works it to leg, and with soft hands. That gives him time to come back for the second
full and just outside off, Dhoni drives on the walk, can't beat mid-off
full and straight, punched to short midwicket
slower ball, pitched outside leg, tickled away fine of fine leg
slower ball again, beats his shot, draws a big lbw appeal, but the ball is pitched well outside leg
full and straight, defended back to Mortaza
really full, just outside off, dug out to mid-off
on a length, on off, pushed straight of mid-off for a single
beats him for pace. Lovely aggressive bowling. Short of a length, quick, middle and off, angling away. Raina late into the defensive push
full and straight and fast, flicked away straight to mid-on
slower ball, yorker, Raina is not looking to attack, and keeps this out. Look at the feet, though. He is stuck deep in the crease
full toss. Seems to have slipped out. Steered to third man
short of a length, quick, just outside off, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, defended from deep inside the crease again
bouncer, beats Raina's hook, but it is a wide outside leg
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
slower ball, 109ks, offcutter, middle and off, defended from within the crease
and Raina plays a good shot. No risk involved here. That should release the pressure. He waits and waits until he gets a ball in his half, and drives this on the up, in the air, and over mid-off
slower ball, middle and leg, turning towards off, defended from the crease
another slower ball, Raina gets a stride in to push this to mid-off
stays back to a fullish ball, but the bat comes down just in time to get a single to midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
full and straight, nicely flicked away, but the way he has played this in front of his body you can tell he is still worried about that bouncer
short of a length, pretty straight, sticks in the surface a little. Defended to leg
slower ball, middle and leg, Raina pushes on the walk. To midwicket it goes
full and straight, he gets inside the line to work this to leg. No bouncer this over
short of a length, just outside off, punched in front of third man for two
on a length, on off, pushed wide of cover where Mortaza fields superbly but he allows a second off the over throw
bouncer, pulled away to deep midwicket
full, just outside off, driven to short cover
short ball, chest high, pulled away to fine leg
bouncer, goes over the leg stump, Raina ducks. Touch and go for wide. Not called
short of a length, and this stays low, and Dhoni again manages to keep this out and event takes a single to midwicket
stays back to defend this to short fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to long-off
on a length, into the pads, defended to leg
short of a length, this one bounces extra to get a little on him. Defended
soft hands, works this into the leg side, between the two men deep on the leg side. He rushes back for the second
on a length, middle and off, defended off the front foot
tucked away off the hip for one
leg-stump half-volley, clipped away wide of deep midwicket for two
short of a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover for one
bouncer, over the top of leg stums. Raina ducks it. Called one for the over
short of a length, just outside off, punched wide of point. They take a single even though Nasir gets a hand on to the ball
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
appeal for lbw as the ball doesn't turn and beats his inside edge. Headed down leg? Really close. A strangely aborted shout from Bangladesh
defended off the front foot
short of a length, quick, hits the bottom edge on the dab
punched down to long-on for one
flighted on middle and leg, defended to leg as there is no pace to work with
short of a length, into the pads, helped away for one
tossed up on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on for one n
slow through the air, full, around off, defended to leg
draws Raina forward with a flighted delivery, which goes on straight to beat the outside edge
comes down the track to drive this to long-off
really slow through the air, Dhoni goes back to drop this to leg for a single
short of a length, quick, punched down to long-on
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, goes inside-out, gets it past cover, though
full and quick, pushed to the bowler's right, but Nasir is quick to field it
diving save by Sabbir at short midwicket saves a single
short of a length, faster, worked to square leg
flighted on leg, pushed to long-on
slow through the air, some turn away, Dhoni lunges forward in defence
even slower, even higher, wide outside off, teasing him. Dhoni refuses to be teased, plays just a push-drive to deep cover
arm ball, cut away, and misfielded by Nasir at cover-point to allow the first boundary since the 27th over. Brings up fifty for the partnership
flat delivery, pushed back to him
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
punched down to long-off for another single
on a length, on off, pushed to point
and there is a quick single to cover, and seems Mustafizur has learnt his lesson and has gone straight in his follow-through as opposed to cutting across

and Mustafixzur has struck immediately. The cutter again. Raina hasn't picked it. This is a short ball, which usually means Raina's mind half-stops working immediately. On top of that it is a cutter that has stuck into the surface and bounced like a tennis ball to take the top edge as Raina looks to run this down to third man. The edge is taken through to the keeper
huge lbw shout. This is full, regulation pace, beats his inside edge as Jadeja plays across the line. Looks good live time, but Tucker seems to have made a good decision: going down the line perhaps
yorker gone wrong, the low full toss that is pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, on off, Dhoni can't do much other than defend to point
slower ball, on off, defended off the front foot by Jadeja
on a length, slower offcutter again, Jadeja dabs on it, but can't send it anywhere
whipped away off the pads, between fine leg and deep square leg. Comes back for two
short of a length, no room, Jadeja dabs it towards point
short of a length, punched into the pitch, and it bounces over Mortaza's head for a single
slower ball, offcutter, defended to leg
length ball, angling in, beats the inside edge, but going down
whipped away but straight to short midwicket. These fielders are all cutting singles
yorker, just outside off, hits the toe of the bat
full, into the pads, worked to deep midwicket for one
offcutter, on a length, middle and leg, defended to cover. Takes the single
full toss, a low one, beats his inside edge as Jadeja plays across its line again
short of a length, middle and off, punched down to long-on for one
slower ball, cut away to third man for one
on a length, holds its line a touch, pushed down to long-on for one
slower ball, full, pushed towards long-off for one
slower ball, offcutter, pushed to short midwicket
slower ball again, on off, on a length, another defensive
on a length, angling in, not getting any timing. Pushed to short midwicket
tries a yorker, Jadeja walks down to take it on the full, drives it to long-on for one

huge wicket. Dhoni has been delaying that final push because wickets have been falling, and now he himself falls. The lethal cutter of Mustafizur again. Dhoni hasn't picked it, and he is early into the shot. Ends up jabbing at a length ball, and the ball lobs to short cover

he is on a hat-trick. Axar has a golden duck. Bangladesh on fire. 25000 people on their feet. Smart bowling. First ball to a new batsman in pressure situation? Straight. On middle stump. And this is a seam-up delivery. Pitches just outside off, angling in towards middle, Axar plays across the line for his third duck in his last four innings
full and on off, Ashwin keeps it out. Takes a single to cover
full and straight. A yorker. Just too straight, and goes for four leg-byes to fine leg
slow through the air, on off, defended to short cover
short of a length, into the pads, punched away to leg for one
slow through the air, short of a length, dropped to leg for one
flighted just outside off, defended off the front foot
flighted outside off again, pushed for a single to long-off
arm ball, pitches outside leg, slides to hit his pad
on a length, regulation pace, pushes this down at his feet and rushes through for one
full, on off, pushed to long-on for one
slower ball, pitches leg, cuts away, defended off the back foot
nearly the five-for. Seam-up, angling across him, beats the outside edge. Ashwin is off balance as he looks to push at this
the cutter this time, short of a length, pitched outside leg, cuts away, defended off the back foot

Ashwin is walking. There is a five-for for Mustafizur. They have all surrounded him in jubilation. Only the second bowler after Brian Vittori to take five-fors in his first two ODIs. Another offcutter. It is a length ball, dips a little, and Ashwin is pushing at it in front of his body. The beauty of this cutter is that it is only slightly off pace, which means the edge carries to the keeper. What joy on the young man's face. Lovely to watch
flighted on the pads, worked to leg
short ball, and Jadeja rocks back to cut that for four. A rare loose ball, and he cashes in
flighted outside off, driven to long-on for one
tossed up, really full, dug out for a single to long-off
slightly short of a length, punched to short midwicket
flighted high, really slow in the air, defended back to him
short of a length, sharp delivery, but is a wide down the leg side
short of a length, Jadeja walks down to run this down to third man for one
short of a length, seam-up, defended off the back foot
what a mean little offcutter. What sting in it. Short of a length, pitched outside leg, cuts away, bounces extra, beats the outside edge
another lovely cutter. They have no clue. That wrist does it again. Short of a length, just at the leg stump, he plays at it, and is beaten as the ball spits away
another lovely cutter, this time finds the edge, and it goes down for a single

and he has a six-for. Mustafizur has sent the crowd into a frenzy. He has 11 wickets in two matches. Full and straight to end the spell, Jadeja plays across its line, hits it into his pad, and the ricochets rattles the stumps. What a spell from Mustafizur
on a length, fast, beats the inside edge, hits the pad, concedes a leg-bye
full, just outside off, dug out for another single
full, on off, pushed to mid-off for one
yorker, nearly squeezes it under the at, but Kulkarni gets the bat down in time. Only a single
on a length, driven on the up, but straight to short cover
bouncer, and India are bowled out in 45 overs. What joy in the stands. Hossain bowls this at his head, Kumar looks to get his head out of the way and then pull it. Manages only to glove it through
short of a length, middle and off, angling away, left alone
shimmies down a little, mis-hits this shortish ball to cover
and the wrost ball to bowl with the keeper standing up. A big leg-side wide. Dhoni does well to get hids gloves around and concede only one wide
some swing for Kumar, but he is headed down leg when he hits Sarka's pad
on a length, on off, pushed back to Kumar
drives. A bit loose. Away from the body. His feet don't take him towards the ball, but he gets a thick inside edge that goes wide of mid-on
short ball, and he pulls it over square leg. Not in control of it at all, but manages to clear the man inside the circle
a bit of shape around off, coming back in, defended to mid-off

is this a clean catch or not? Soft signal is not out. Tamim dances down the track, drives this towards mid-off where Kohli claims a catch. The angles so far are not great, the soft signal is not out, and this is looking good for Tamim right now. It is impossible to tell from the angles we have. Kohli claims it immediately, but you can't say either way with such shoddy pictures. Tamim bats on. A cheer goes around. Kohli has a word with the umpire, which draws a round of boos. He is still shaking his head
slower ball outside off as he sees Tamim advance. Wided outside off
that will rub a block of crystallised salt into the wound. Half-volley outside off, and he has dismissed it through extra cover for four. Past, well, Kohli
slight shape back in, respectfully played down to mid-off
swinging in, beats the inside edge, concedes a leg-bye
this will annoy India further. Sarkar is looking midwicket, hitting third man. The head falls away as he slogs, but the outside edge flies over the slips' heads
short and wide, gets away with it. Tamim's cut finds point
length ball, middle and off, defended off the front foot
one-bounce four. Tamim is ripping into this target. Audacious shot. This is just short of a length, but he plays a pick-up over midwicket for four
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, pitched outside leg, with fine leg up. He has flicked it past that man for four more
bouncer, that looked over head to me, but it hasn't been called a wide
tossed up on off, no turn, gets an inside edge onto the pad
down the wicket, beaten in the flight by a wide offbreak, but does enough to get his toe end on to the ball
flatter delivery, defended off the back foot
slower through the air, offbreak, lovely offbreak, beats the outside edge
arm ball, fired in, takes the inside edge, goes for two runs fine of short fine leg
tossed up outside off, a calm push to long-off for one
short of a length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, on off, punched to short cover
short of a length, outside off, a lovely square-drive. There is a short cover in place, and the usual cover ring, but he has pierced it
slightly fuller, just outside off, pushed to cover
down the wicket, not in control of this pull at all, but he has managed to clear midwicket
looks to pull, but the ball is not short enough, and it squeezes between the stumps and his bat
spinning away from a length, pushed towards point
good amount of turn once more for Ashwin, left alone by Tamim
length ball on middle and off, plenty of flight, watchful forward defensive from Tamim
dropped it a touch short, Tamim gets on the back foot and guides that towards cover
more careful forward defence from Tamim
fuller and on the pads, a loose delivery to end the over, guided behind square leg
guided off the front foot in front of point
slower full ball outside off, Kulkarni rolls his fingers across it, Tamim looked to carve that through cover, top edges it for a loopy catch to slip, India get their first
short ball from Kulkarni, was that too high? no says the umpire as the ball goes through to the keeper
back of a length and sliding down the leg side, helped behind square leg
length ball on off stump, driven crisply off the front foot but towards the man at cover-point
anopther firm hit from Sarkar, again can't get it past the fielder, cover point stops it
length ball outside off, carefully defended to the off side
length ball heading for middle stump, stylishly picked up and dispatched over midwicket for four
trying to be cute, and super early in his innings as well, this was a shortish ball well outside off, Litton tries to twirl that towards fine leg, no contact
a touch fuller, again well outside off, Litton isn't tempted into some innovative stroke this time, happoy to let it through to the keeper
fuller than the previous one, driven off the front foot towards cover point
again way outside off stump, tapped towards cover to end the over
length ball from round the wicket, heading for middle stump, patted back towards the bowler, again this was a slower one from Kulkarni
short of length, on middle and off, more defence towards the bowler
shorter and into the body, Sarkar goes for the pull, can't connect properly and the ball rolls behind square leg, some dot balls being bowled here, the asking rate remains low
again the slower one, again Sarkar can't time it as he looks to loft over mid-on, just clears the man in the ring
a bit shorter, goes back in the crease and defends down the pitch
bouncer from over the wicket to end the over, Sarkar wants to pull that but he misses
lovely shot. Shortish ball angling in from wide on the crease, punched away past mid-on for three. All along the ground

India think they have got him but this has come off the helmet. It is a good bouncer, which beats the top edge and hits the badge on the helmet and lobs up to Dhoni. India look disbelievingly, but the correct decision has been made. Called one for the over with a raised index finger to tease India more
another bouncer, and called a wide this time
this short ball doesn't rise, and is pulled off the toe end to mid-on

this has to be frustrating. Sarkar is going a shot a minute and getting away with some loose ones, and in between he plays some excellent ones like this. Short of a length, outside off, stands tall and punches this to the right of backward point
slower ball, short of a length, opens the face, gets a single to third man
short of a length, angling in, worked into the leg side for one
Das down the wicket, beaten in flight, plays a defensive to midwicket
flighted middle and leg, defended to leg
defended to cover
sharp turn, flies off the thigh pad, goes for a leg-bye
flatter delivery, defended to cover
another risky shot from Sarkar. An almighty slog-sweep, which he misses by a day. yet he gets away with it. The off stump watches it go six inches wide

and they are not letting the new bowler settle. Slog-sweep first ball, and he clears midwicket. It is a difficult shot to play, given the trajectory and pace of Jadeja, but he has dragged this from outside off, which is the right line to attempt such a shot
pushed down to long-on for one
half an appeal from Jadeja and Dhoni as he beats him with the turn, but it is turning too far
stays back to defend this length ball to leg
slightly short of a length, on the pads, worked away for an easy single
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
flat offbreak, stays back to work this to deep square leg for one
on a length, middle and off, defended back to him
punched down to long-off for another single
sharp offbreak, dipping on him, beats the inside edge, but is headed down leg
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball. Defends
clips this off the pads for a single. Too full, too straight
slightly short, wide, cut away to deep cover
overpitched, clipped away off the toes for a single
short and wide, cut away for another single despite the extra bounce
on a length, turning in, pushed to midwicket
short of a length, gets inside the line, works this to leg
Raina at slip is running here and there anticipating a paddle sweep, but he has played the orthodox sweep for one to deep square leg

last ball he was moving here and there, this time Raina has had no time to move. Ashwin tosses one offbreak up on the pad, Das turns it around the corner, and it has gone between leg slip and the keeper
short of a length, defended to leg
shortish offbreak again, another defensive to leg
down the wicket to push this flighted delivery to long-on
on a length, no turn, hits the inside edge for a single
sharp offbreak, Das wants to cut, is cramped for room, but manages to dab this down into the ground
Sarkar dances down first ball, is beaten in the flight and is hit on the pad
they are not letting these spinners settle. The right line to play slog-sweep. From outside off, and he has made a lovely connection to send this deep into the celebrating stands
pushed through, worked into the on side for one
long hop from the under-pressure Patel, and Das has pulled this through midwicket for four more. The asking rate is under four
slightly fuller and slower, draws a defensive from Das

this is innovative. He has manufactured his own line here by moving across the stumps and has swept this from in front of off and middle. No power required. Patel's pace does the trick as this goes past square leg for four more
flat length ball, defended off the front foot
defended with an open face
sharp turn and bounce, angling in, on off, and spits away to beat the edge

this is a shooter to get Sarkar out. Flatter, quicker delivery, pitches on a length, Sarkar is justified in staying back, but the ball doesn't come up. It squeezes under the toe of the bat to hit him in the shin. No chance for Sarkar really
steps half-forward to defend an offbreak
a sharp offbreak that hits him in the ribs ends a wicket-maiden. Can India make something out of this?
flat ball, Das looks to pull, is hurried into it by a quick delivery
tossed up this time, defended to cover
really quick delivery, 95ks, hits him in the rib cage as he looks to pull
pushes this flighted delivery to deep cover for one
leading edge as he looks to work this to leg, but it is a soft edge and doesn't carry back to Patel
flat, short and wide, and Rahim loves it there. He back-cuts it past the diving man at point. That should get him going
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, is hit on the pad
overpitched this offbreak, clipped to wide long-on for one

and there is the odd bad ball that Ashwin tends to bowl once in a while. This is short, with an attacking field in place, and Rahim has enough time to go back to punch this through vast open spaces in the covers
slog-swept along the ground for one
tossed up, middle and leg, easily worked away for one
flighted offbreak, but into the pads, clipped to short midwicket
short of a length, on off stump, punched to point

Dhoni takes the catch on the rebound, India are still in. A loose shot. Bangladesh getting complacent here. This is a flat length ball outside off, Das pushes at it, away from his body, and edges it through. Dhoni's gloves close early but the rebound doesn't go too far away. India very much in this contest
flat ball, stays back, turns this around the corner for one
slower through the air, defended back to him
pushed through, stays back to defend
flighted, middle and leg, defended to leg
lovely offbreak. It drifts in, dips on him, lands on a length in front of off, and then breaks away to beat the edge
looks to sweep, is beaten in the flight, but goes ahead with it, and it lands safe. Rayudu from long leg has to run to his right and put a dive in to save two runs. Target under 100 now
this time a proper old-fashioned slog sweep despite not being to the pitch of it. Risky batting but he gets four for it
defended off the front foot this time
slows this down, hands it in the air, middle and leg. Defended off the front foot
fired in, Shakib rocks back to help this around the corner for a single
full and flat, clipped away off the toes

dropped. Some turn for Patel as Rahim defends. He gets a sharp edge that goes to the right of Dhoni's glove and to the left of Raina at slip. Raina gets a hand to it, but this is going too fast for him to catch
solid front-foot defensive
another defensive shot, this time with an open face
flatter delivery, stays back to defend
looks to late-cut this but can't beat short fine leg
plays the delicate lap sweep, from in front of the stumps, gets a couple
quicker, flatter, he picks the trajectory early, and defends off the back foot
a nothing shot. Quite an ordinary shot. No shape, just throws his arms at one tossed up outside off. Gets a thick outside edge but it somehow clears cover
looks for the late cut, is beaten by the extra bounce
flighted outside off, dips on him, turns back in, hits the pad, but is turning too much
solid front-foot defensive to end the over
fired into the pads, helped around the corner for a single
Patel slows it down, and draws some turn to beat the outside edge
pushes this flighted ball into the covers for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
flatter, on off, defended off the back foot
tossed up on off, turns away, takes a soft thick outside edge
flighted on middle and leg, defended off the front foot
slower still, dipping on him, Shakib presses forward to defend
tries to force an offbreak outside off and is beaten. He needs to realise this is Ashwin's last over. Just play him out
flatter and straighter, he stays back to defend
tosses this up, but overpitches, and is picked away off the toes for one
sharp turn down the leg side to be called a wide. Dhoni, while making the collection, shouts, "Catch it."
flatter, defended to leg. That does it for Ashwin. Bangladesh can breathe half a sigh of relief now
down the wicket, drives a full ball to long-on for one

beautiful shot. That might be the shot of the match. He is down the wicket, deliberately not right to the pitch of it. He has left himself some room to swing his arms through it, and chips it over extra cover
after that touch shot Rahim brings out the brute force, slog-sweeping this for six into the cow corner. With Ashwin out of the attack, Bangladesh are now looking to finish this off in a hurry
drives this along the ground to long-off
full and flat, pushed to cover
this is a Shakib special. This is only slightly short of a length, but he has rocked back to use all of Patel's pace to send this between point and short third man. Target under 70 now
flighted outside off, takes a thick inside edge as he looks to work this to leg
down the wicket to drills this past the diving Raina. It's not too far to his right, but he has smashed this hard. Even long-off can't keep it in
down the wicket to chip this to long-on for one
short of a length, on the stumps, but he moves back to open the face on it
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
pushed to long-off for another single. Target under 60 now
gets this to dip a little and beat him in the flight, but the ball is headed down leg
short of a length, turning in, he looks to force it behind square, but finds cover-point
sharp turn from middle and off, and is called a wide
looks to sweep, early into the shot, gets a bottom shot towards short fine
short of a length, flick-pulled into the gap on the on side for a couple
stays back to drop this length ball into the leg side for one
flat ball, on a length, defended off the back foot
stays leg-side of a flat delivery. Defends with an open face
shapes up to slog-sweep, but the ball doesn't arrive, and his check shot falls safe to Raina's left
fired in, Rahim sees it early, and ramps this fine of fine leg for a couple
stays back to defend an offbreak to leg
goes leg side of an offbreak, Raina fires it in, and he defends
flighted outside off, driven with an open face, between cover and extra cover for three runs. Target under 50 now

short and wide, cut away square of deep cover. He comes back for a second run, but Rahim's strides and Dhoni's fox-like work runs him out. The throw is not exceptionally fast so he leaves his station at the stumps, moves towards the stumps, and then deflects it between his legs with his back to the stumps. Guess what, he has hit the stumps. That is some work by MS Dhoni
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
flighted into the pads, worked to leg for one
tossed up on off, defended with an open face
flighted, middle and off, defended back to him
fired in, pretty straight, defended to leg
short of a length, not enough room to play the cut, but he gets a single off the dab
misses out. This is a shortish ball down the pads, all it needs is a tickle to send it for four, but Sabbir misses, and gets just the leg-bye
bouncer, good sharp bounce. Not quite. It is called a wide for height. Slightly harsh on Kularni
slower ball, just outside off, Shakib stays back to open the face, but can't guide it past slip
another slower ball, and Shakib shows a lovely touch. He waits and waits for it, and then open the face at the last moment to guide this between the keeper and the wide slip. Target under 40 now
short of a length, wide, punched to deep point
short of a length, getting high, tucked away off the armpit
angling in, no turn, helped into the leg side for one
flatter, into the pads, defended to leg
slower in the air, driven to long-on for another single
short of a length, gets good bounce, but is punched to deep cover
pushed to long-on for one
shorter, flatter, cut away for one
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
into the pads, gets lucky that he has clipped it straight to fine leg for one
short of a length, just outside off, punched to point
short and wide, cut away for a single
slower short ball, pulled away, can't beat square leg
bouncer, quick one, but it is a wide down the leg side. Target is under 30 now
short of a length, beats his flick-pull, flies off the thigh pad to square leg. India make half an appeal for a catch but this is heights of optimism
flighted outside off, defended towards the bowler
flighted again, meets a dead bat
flatter, stays back to defend
pushed into the pads, easily worked away for a single
short of a length, on off, turning away, punched to deep cover
shortish, into the pads, worked past the backward short leg
short and wide, cut away for a single. Asking rate under two an over now

that's dismissive. That's disdainful. That is showing Bangladesh belong. This is a full ball, he clears the front leg and sends it crashing between mid-ff and the bowler. Doesn't even look where the ball has gone. Stylish
short ball, pulled to short midwicket. Words exchanged between the bowler and the batsman. Mortaza is applauding from the balcony
bouncer, Sabbir thinks of ramping him, but withdraws from the shot as it is too high
slower bouncer, he has to check the pull, but gets a single to long leg
slower short ball, punched to third man. Target under 20 now
short of a length, turning in, defended to leg
gets this to jump at him, but Shakib does well to keep the defensive shot down
fired in, Shakib is caught in a shimmy down the wicket, but defends it well
turning into the pads, defended to short leg
stays back to defend a flat delivery
breaks the maiden by working this to long leg for one
short of a length, outside leg, easy single for Shakib
short, wide, backs away to cut it in front of square, past the diving Dhawan at cover. Even closer. The party is about to begin

nearly hit wicket. This is into the ribs, he looks to tuck it away, but it has pushed him way back in the crease. In fact he has landed behind the stumps but just outside off. He somehow manages to acrobatically avoid the stumps as he falls down the leg side
dismissed out of his sight. He is waiting for another short ball with the front leg out of the way, and he pulls it between mid-on and midwicket for four
short again, this time pulled to fine leg for one
wide down the leg side. The bouncer but inaccurate
short again, pulled away for a single to deep midwicket. One shot to go now
Jadeja drops short, and he pulls it through midwicket for four to bring up a fifty. Another reason to celebrate in Dhaka
fired into the pads, defended to leg
pushed to mid-on
defended solidly
down the wicket, the crowd roars, but he gets just the single to long-on

gets extra bounce, runs it down to third man to win the series. That's 10 home matches in a ow. That's Champions Trophy spot sealed. No crazy celebration. Just a matter-of-fact look. These are no crazy upsets. This is a better team in the conditions and on the days dominating the other
